prompt: Deadpan corporate technical diagram, clean vector lines, subtle shadows, off-white background, muted slate + graphite with cyan and safety orange accents. Big central diagram, consistent title placement top-left. Only include the exact text specified. No other text or numbers. Title text in top-left: 'Do the work'. Diagram: an oversized rubber stamp slams onto a simple slide icon, with a dramatic burst mark. The stamp face reads 'DO YOUR OWN WORK'. Only text: 'Do the work', 'DO YOUR OWN WORK'.
rubric: The slide uses a clean, technical diagram style with deadpan humor.
Title text reads exactly 'Do the work'.
The stamp face reads exactly 'DO YOUR OWN WORK'.
No extra text appears beyond the specified labels.
A large stamp and a slide icon are clearly visible.

improvements: Ensure the central object being stamped is unambiguously a ‘simple slide icon’ rather than a playground slide by simplifying its form or adding subtle UI-context cues (e.g., squared corners, window frame outline) while still avoiding extra text.
grade.summary: All rubric requirements are met: clean, technical, deadpan style with muted palette and subtle shadows; title text is exactly ‘Do the work’ placed top-left; stamp face reads exactly ‘DO YOUR OWN WORK’; no extra text appears; a large stamp and a slide-like icon are clearly visible; and the composition is intentionally over-the-top with a dramatic burst effect. Minor possible refinement would be making the slide icon read more clearly as a slide graphic rather than a playground slide, but this doesn’t violate any stated criteria.
